intro: Randia impressinervis, commonly known as the narrow-veined randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with prominent, parallel veins. Its small, white to pale pink flowers are typically clustered in inflorescences. Randia impressinervis is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forest understories and along stream banks.
